description:
WHO WE ARE: 
  As part of the team at EVIK Diagnostics Innovations you’ll discover meaningful work within the medical device industry. You’ll join a rapidly growing company where each day is different, and opportunities are approached with a team effort.
  
  
  Evik was established in 2011 and is based in Kanata (in the same building as a brewery!) Our team are experts in the field of creating rapid, single-assay lyophilized beads for immunological and molecular diagnostics. Our DxSpheres are used for a wide variety of different testing applications including rapid PCR Covid test kits, and in environmental water testing laboratories. Our clients are located around the world and appreciate our transparency, communication, and ability to go the extra mile.
  
  
  If you’d like to learn more about us and what we do, feel free to check out our website and watch our company video.
  
  
  Evik Diagnostic Innovations is an Ottawa based ISO 13485:2016 certified manufacturer of rapid, single-assay, lyophilized beads for immunological and molecular diagnostics using dry reagent components. We provide exceptional customer service to our clients, and we are looking for a new team member to help us continue to exceed their expectations. You are an ideal candidate if you are looking to become part of a dynamic team.
 
  JOB DESCRIPTION 
  Employees in this position support successful optimization and transferring to production of new products and processes such as formulating the reagent mixes, freeze-dryer capacity, sorting/sifting, packaging, including activities listed below.
  
  
  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
  
  Manage multiple tasks and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment. 
  Adhere to current good manufacturing practices (GMP) to maintain a safe and clean work environment. 
  Design, schedule, and execute reagent formulations, dispense, and freeze-dry processes utilizing standard laboratory techniques. 
  Dismantle, clean, sanitize, re-assemble, and configure all required laboratory equipment. 
  Perform freeze-drying procedures, perform post-lyophilization product analysis and packaging. 
  Participate in development of analytical methods for new product QC procedures, write QC documents for new products. 
  Participate in designing of validation procedures for new production and quality control processes. 
  Perform process verification and validation. 
  Design and execute studies to support successful optimization and transferring to production of new products and processes (such as formulating the reagent mixes, freeze-dryer capacity, sorting/sifting, packaging) 
  Plan, organize, and oversee the utilization of equipment, material, and space to achieve optimum efficiency in tech transfer department. 
  Summarize and analyze freeze-dry cycle data. 
  Documents all development, process optimization and validation efforts in appropriate logs, forms, reports, and databases. 
  Write, edit and proofread work instructions. 
  Maintain operation equipment conditions through responsive troubleshooting, preventive maintenance, repairs, and compliance with operational guidelines. 
  Train operators on new products and processes. 
  Maintain a healthy work environment through the enforcement of applicable government Health and Safety guidelines and company mandated PPE requirements. 
  Decide on and take necessary action to eliminate work hazards and observe and enforce safety regulations. Participate in the investigation and reporting of accidents. 
  Identify and drive improvements in productivity including yield, scrap, re-work, and downtime. 
  Participate in process improvement projects assigned by department manager. 
  Perform any other related tasks assigned by department manager.
 
  
  
  Occasionally: 
  
  Operates various laboratory equipment including, but not limited to, standard hand tools, custom fixtures, and other tooling. 
  Assembles medical device diagnostic cartridges of varying design. 
  Supports improvements to the team by providing and receiving training on new equipment, processes, or products. 
  Performs other duties and special projects deemed appropriate for this position.
 
  
  
  SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS 
  
  Master’s degree in biochemistry or pharmaceutical discipline. An equivalent combination of relevant job experience and training will be considered. 
  Three years relevant work experience. 
  Excellent English language communication skills both written and oral. 
  Experience in medical devices industry or lab environment will be considered an asset. 
  Ability to work without direct supervision, paying close attention to detail and bearing independent responsibility for data accuracy. 
  Sound organizational and data management skills, ability to handle several responsibilities and work under tight time constraints. 
  Demonstrated ability in laboratory techniques (required). 
  Good level of mastery of skills in formulation science in a GMP environment. 
  A positive attitude and professional appearance and manner. 
  Dedication to production quality and deadlines with a strong work ethic.
